name: teamtnt

procedures: T1007::[TeamTNT] has searched for services such as Alibaba Cloud Security's aliyun service and BMC Helix Cloud Security's bmc-agent service in order to disable them.
T1014::[TeamTNT] has used rootkits such as the open-source Diamorphine rootkit and their custom bots to hide cryptocurrency mining activities on the machine.
T1016::[TeamTNT] has enumerated the host machineâ€™s IP address.
T1021.004::[TeamTNT] has used SSH to connect back to victim machines.
T1027.002::[TeamTNT] has used UPX and Ezuri packer to pack its binaries.
T1027::[TeamTNT] has encrypted its binaries via AES and encoded files using Base64.
T1036.005::[TeamTNT] has replaced .dockerd and .dockerenv with their own scripts and cryptocurrency mining software.
T1036::[TeamTNT] has disguised their scripts with docker-related file names.
T1046::[TeamTNT] has used masscan to search for open Docker API ports and Kubernetes clusters.
T1048::[TeamTNT] has sent locally staged files with collected credentials to C2 servers using cURL.
T1049::[TeamTNT] has run netstat -anp to search for rival malware connections.
T1057::[TeamTNT] has searched for rival malware and removes it if found.
T1059.001::[TeamTNT] has executed PowerShell commands in batch scripts.
T1059.003::[TeamTNT] has used batch scripts to download tools and executing cryptocurrency miners.
T1059.004::[TeamTNT] has used shell scripts for execution.
T1070.002::[TeamTNT] has removed system logs from /var/log/syslog.
T1070.003::[TeamTNT] has cleared command history with history -c.

T1070.004::[TeamTNT] has used a payload that removes itself after running. [TeamTNT] also has deleted locally staged files for collecting credentials or scan results for local IP addresses after exfiltrating them.
T1071.001::[TeamTNT] has the `curl` command to send credentials over HTTP and the `curl` and `wget` commands to download new software.
T1071::[TeamTNT] has used an IRC bot for C2 communications.
T1074.001::[TeamTNT] has aggregated collected credentials in text files before exfiltrating.
T1082::[TeamTNT] has searched for system version, architecture, disk partition, logical volume, and hostname information.
T1083::[TeamTNT] has used a script that checks `/proc/*/environ` for environment variables related to AWS.
T1098.004::[TeamTNT] has added RSA keys in authorized_keys.
T1102::[TeamTNT] has leveraged iplogger.org to send collected data back to C2.
T1105::[TeamTNT] has the curl and wget commands as well as batch scripts to download new tools.
T1120::[TeamTNT] has searched for attached VGA devices using lspci.
T1133::[TeamTNT] has used open-source tools such as Weave Scope to target exposed Docker API ports and gain initial access to victim environments.
T1136.001::[TeamTNT] has created local privileged users on victim machines.
T1140::[TeamTNT] has used a script that decodes a Base64-encoded version of WeaveWorks Scope.
T1204.003::[TeamTNT] has relied on users to download and execute malicious Docker images.
T1219::[TeamTNT] has established tmate sessions for C2 communications.
T1222.002::[TeamTNT] has modified the permissions on binaries with chattr.
T1496::[TeamTNT] has deployed XMRig Docker images to mine cryptocurrency.
T1518.001::[TeamTNT] has searched for security products on infected machines.
T1543.002::[TeamTNT] has established persistence through the creation of a cryptocurrency mining system service using systemctl.
T1543.003::[TeamTNT] has used malware that adds cryptocurrency miners as a service.
T1547.001::[TeamTNT] has added batch scripts to the startup folder.
T1552.001::[TeamTNT] has searched for unsecured AWS credentials and Docker API credentials.
T1552.004::[TeamTNT] has searched for unsecured SSH keys.
T1552.005::[TeamTNT] has queried the AWS instance metadata service for credentials.
T1562.001::[TeamTNT] has disabled and uninstalled security tools such as Alibaba, Tencent, and BMC cloud monitoring agents on cloud-based infrastructure.
T1562.004::[TeamTNT] has disabled iptables.
T1569::[TeamTNT] has created system services to execute cryptocurrency mining software.
T1583.001::[TeamTNT] has obtained domains to host their payloads.
T1587.001::[TeamTNT] has developed custom malware such as [Hildegard].
T1595.001::[TeamTNT] has scanned specific lists of target IP addresses.
T1595.002::[TeamTNT] has scanned for vulnerabilities in IoT devices and other related resources such as the Docker API.
T1608.001::[TeamTNT] has uploaded backdoored Docker images to Docker Hub.
T1609::[TeamTNT] executed [Hildegard] through the kubelet API run command and by executing commands on running containers.
T1610::[TeamTNT] has deployed different types of containers into victim environments to facilitate execution.
T1611::[TeamTNT] has deployed privileged containers that mount the filesystem of victim machine.
T1613::[TeamTNT] has checked for running containers with docker ps and for specific container names with docker inspect.

description: [TeamTNT](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0139) is a threat group that has primarily targeted cloud and containerized environments. The group as been active since at least October 2019 and has mainly focused its efforts on leveraging cloud and container resources to deploy cryptocurrency miners in victim environments.(Citation: Palo Alto Black-T October 2020)(Citation: Lacework TeamTNT May 2021)(Citation: Intezer TeamTNT September 2020)(Citation: Cado Security TeamTNT Worm August 2020)(Citation: Unit 42 Hildegard Malware)(Citation: Trend Micro TeamTNT)(Citation: ATT TeamTNT Chimaera September 2020)(Citation: Aqua TeamTNT August 2020)(Citation: Intezer TeamTNT Explosion September 2021)
